column10: power down DIG Voltage Regulator (turn ON by default). Ie. When = 0, chip will be ON, when = 1 chip will be OFF. Upon RST, everything incl. digital reg will be set to zero which will switch digital back on.
column12: DVDD and DVSS are digital supply and ground

column10: Resistor Trim in AFE Voltage Regulator
Resistor Trim in ADC Voltage Regulator
Resistor Trim in Dig Voltage Regulator
enable bias section (CR2V) to generate PTAT current
enable bias current to go to ATM (TESTNAN1) for resistor calibration

column12: Register names in bold indicate that there are spare unusued bits in the address at these locations

column10: set sensing mode (0 = mono polar, 1 - bi polar). Set once.
enable external REF buffer ( 0 = bypass mode)
set electrode reference (0 = external, 1 = internal). If buffer is not needed, disable and bypass, else keep this enabled.
Bypass the LPF (sending AFELNA outputs direct to AFEBUF)
enable monitoring temperature sensor (sending to either ADC or TESTANA1)
Enable the LNA outputs to go directly to the ATM (bypassing the AFEBUF, for testing the LNA on its own)
Enable the LPF outputs to go directly to the ATM (bypassing the AFEBUF, for testing the LPF on its own)
(This is to replace the  ATMCHSEL<7:0>) Enable the monitoring of the AFE section. When disable the other signals, i.e. Tsense, can be sent through the AFEBUF to the ADC.
Enables the switching on and off of channels in a sequence
enable sensing channel. This will select all the channels to be sampled.
enable sending AFELNA out through ATM
enable sending AFELPF out through ATM
enable sending AFELNA out through ATM
Bypass the ATM buffer (for sending current outputs or sending the AFEBUF outputs to external ADC) through TESTANA1/2
Select operation mode of the ATM (detail configuration TBD)
This will enable the analog part of the ADC to switch ON. Switching this OFF will disable only the analog part of the ADC.
Digital Debug Output. GPIO connection as well as read through SPI?
How many frames of data before DATAREADY goes high
Enable writing registers whilst sampling is running - not recommended
HF_CLK will be updated in schematics to match the names
Active low, since noise could couple onto pin and cause accidental reset upon testing.
Will this be replaced with DIGDEBUG? this is planed as discussed with Liuwe to send the DIGDEBUG directly out to the GPIO. (need sorting out connection)
Turn OFF sense chip (at the moment also a chip pin). Issue: if this is 1.8V provided externally, cannot use the level shifter to boost to 5V since min req: 2V - digital cannot resolve this
Interrupt pin to flag errors and status bit results from FIFO and sampling
Control signal to enable the digital part of the ADC to be switched ON. Switching the OFF will disable the digital part of the ADC. Formally nARST
sending Channel Saturation to the Digital Section
Similar to CHSEL, except this selects channel in ATM and/or temp sense
Buffered HF_CLK that will take HF_CLK and pass through a digital buffer. This will be used for debug for the ADC if used. May be passthrough of clock divider. Do we need this?
